page.title: 06BINHAM MANOR FARM CONT.
page.content: Binham Manor Farm is regarded as one of the oldest in the area. It was restored in 1624 and it is believed to have been built in the early 14th century. The buildings are made of red sandstone and displays some interesting features of a traditional farm house. Today, there are 5 men working the farm which indicates the extent to which modern technology has released farmers from the cost of employing farm hands. This farm displays an intensity of single product farming which compares with the Crossman in Withycombe.
